title: High Female Leadership in Business
description: In 2016, 64.8% of firms in Thailand had female top managers, showcasing a strong representation of women in leadership roles.

title: Comprehensive Birth Registration in Urban Areas
description: By 2019, Thailand achieved a 100% completeness rate in birth registration for urban areas, ensuring all births are officially recorded.

title: Effective Social Insurance Programs
description: In 2021, social insurance programs in Thailand covered 92.99% of the total welfare needs of beneficiary households, reflecting a robust social safety net.

title: Minimal Health Expenditure-Induced Poverty
description: In 2021, only 0.01% of Thailand's population was pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses, indicating effective health cost management.

title: Low Tariff Complexity on Manufactured Goods
description: In 2015, only 0.00045% of Thailand's tariff lines for manufactured products had specific rates, simplifying trade regulations.

title: Limited Support from UNIDO
description: In 2020, Thailand experienced a net negative flow of -$2,096.82 from UNIDO, indicating limited financial support from this UN agency.

title: High Female Unpaid Domestic Work
description: In 2015, Thai women spent 11.04% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, highlighting gender disparities in household responsibilities.
